title: Minehead
summary: Minehead is a coastal town and civil parish in Somerset, England. It lies on the south bank of the Bristol Channel, 21 miles (34 km) north-west of the county town of Taunton, 12 miles (19 km) from the border with the county of Devon and in proximity of the Exmoor National Park. The parish of Minehead has a population of approximately 11,981, making it the most populous town in the western part of the Somerset West and Taunton local government district,[1] which in turn, is the worst area in the country for social mobility.[2] This figure includes Alcombe and Woodcombe, suburban villages which have been subsumed into Minehead.
